column2: Pegasus Mortgages Lending Center is a boutique multi-national mortgage brokerage with offices in Toronto, Canada, and Miami, USA. We work with a variety of banks, professional associations, alternative and private lenders. We are looking for a visionary, driven self-starter to be our Manager of Digital Marketing Strategy. Reporting directly to our Director of Operations and Strategy along with our Operations Director, you will be responsible to develop and manage marketing strategy, programs in specific channels, support business objectives, lead acquisition strategies, foster customer retention, execute business development, provide sales support, and advance brand building in a leadership role. Major Responsibilities: Digital Marketing Leadership: Lead and execute digital marketing projects, with a focus on Facebook and other major social media platforms, delivering high-quality results aligned with company business objectives. Service Offering Development: Identify and develop narratives for service offerings to expand company services and attract new clients. Strategic Planning Across Channels: Develop comprehensive digital marketing strategies for various channels including digital, email, SEO, loyalty, and social media, utilizing necessary tools. Marketing Audits: Conduct audits of companys' marketing initiatives, develop strategies for proposals, and present findings and solutions to internal and external stakeholders. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with stakeholders in preparing and delivering company presentations, addressing inquiries, and ensuring optimal solution delivery. KPIs and Benchmarks: Define key performance indicators and benchmarks to align strategies with project goals. Channel Partnership Management: Engage in channel partnership management to maintain industry thought-leadership and excellence. Expertise in Company Solutions: Provide expertise to Accounts, Revenue, and Solutions teams for developing company solutions and proposals. Ideation to Delivery: Participate in the entire process of solution development from ideation to delivery, including cost estimation. Company Interaction: Attend company meetings and pitches to propose solutions. Cross-Company Opportunities: Utilize understanding of various clients to identify and capitalize on opportunities. Quality Assurance: Ensure high-quality project deliverables and enforce quality standards. Team Mentorship: Mentor team members in developing technical and channel-specific skills, and review their deliverables for improvement. Industry Trends and Training: Stay informed on digital marketing trends, maintain certifications, and deliver training on digital marketing tactics. Performance Metrics Analysis: Monitor and analyze companys' marketing and sales metrics to forecast trends and recommend new solutions. Reporting and Insight Sharing: Prepare and present company reports, sharing insights with stakeholders. Process Improvement: Develop internal initiatives for process improvement. Training Delivery: Conduct training sessions on digital marketing tactics and tools. Required Experience: Educational Background: A degree in Marketing or a related field. Professional Experience: At least 10 years in marketing roles with management and senior position exposure, including a minimum of 5 years in digital social media marketing and Google Analytics. Project Management: Proven experience in managing projects effectively. Market Knowledge: Experience in the US and Canadian markets is preferred. Strategic Execution: Demonstrated ability to execute strategic initiatives. CRM and Project Management Systems: Working knowledge of various CRM and project/task management systems. Budget and Revenue Management: Experience in budget planning and revenue forecasting. Cross-Channel Marketing Automation Tools: Familiarity with tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Marketo, Adobe Cloud, etc. Sales Acumen: Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with a customer-focused orientation. Industry-Specific Experience: Experience in financial, banking, or mortgage products is preferred. Adaptability and Independence: Ability to work independently and adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment. Lean Six Sigma Certification: While not mandatory, having a Lean Six Sigma Certification is an asset. Other Requirement: A desktop workstation based on our specifications with 2 hours battery backup A headset microphones Internet with backup power Electricity backup (Ups/Generator/Others) Dedicated area/separate room for work Job Type: Full-time Permanent Schedule: Eastern Standard Time (Toronto time) Monday to Friday 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM

column2: Performance   Marketer   @   PEOPLE10 THE   OPPORTUNITY As a Performance Marketer at People10, you'll spearhead comprehensive performance marketing strategies across diverse digital channels like PPC, SEM, social media, and more. Your role involves managing end-to-end digital ad campaigns, analyzing metrics using tools like Google Analytics, and optimizing campaign elements for maximum ROI. You'll stay updated on industry trends, conduct A/B testing, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to drive measurable outcomes and achieve KPIs. Work   Location:  Bangalore, India / Remote Experience   level   :  4 - 6 years Roles   &   Responsibilities:  Develop and execute comprehensive performance marketing strategies across various digital channels such  as PPC, SEM, display advertising, social media advertising, email marketing, and affiliate marketing.  Plan and manage digital advertising campaigns from conception to execution, including budget allocation,  targeting, and performance tracking.  Conduct keyword research, analyze competitor activity, and identify opportunities to improve campaign performance and drive cost-effective customer acquisition.  Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics, such as CTR, CPC, CPA, ROAS, and conversion rates,  using analytical tools such as Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, and others.  Identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights  Generate regular reports to track campaign performance, identify trends, and provide insights for optimization  and strategic decision-making.  Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in performance marketing to continuously improve campaign effectiveness and ROI.  Conduct A/B Testing and optimize ad creatives, landing pages, targeting parameters, and other campaign elements to maximize performance and user experience.  Stay abreast of changes in digital advertising platforms, algorithms, and policies to ensure compliance and adapt strategies accordingly. Must-Have   Skills   :  MBA, Bachelors degree in related field. 4-6 years of experience in performance marketing and related fields.  Proven experience in performance marketing, growth marketing in IT services company. Hands-on experience with digital advertising platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, etc.  Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools such as Google Analytics,  Experience in optimizing landing pages and user funnels  Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data to drive actionable insights.  Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills.  Results-oriented mindset with a focus on driving measurable outcomes and achieving KPI.

column2: Role Description: - Crossbeats is seeking an experienced Ecommerce Sales/Business Manager for their Flipkart Marketplace. This would be an onsite role for their office in Bangalore. This role oversees and coordinates all sales activities with Flipkart.  The person will be a member of the eCommerce sales team charged with managing and growing online sales channels, specifically on Flipkart.com. The candidate should have strong sales background and foundation to drive business growth and work with each partner. - The successful candidate will have a firm grasp and understanding of Flipkart 3P business model, site merchandising activities and optimization tactics. Additionally, candidate must have a working knowledge of Flipkart.com and Flipkart Vendor Central. Duties and Responsibilities: - Achieves the net sales budget for Flipkart. - Responsible for complete P/L for Flipkart Marketplace Business.  - Constant focus on reviews and relevancy on Flipkart.com. - Full online ownership of how our product is presented, marketed and perceived. - Manage the day-to-day operations including product content, inventory availability, pricing and promotional activities in order to optimize conversion and revenue. - Work towards meeting revenue budget targets, with a strong ability to manage the P&L. - Develops and maintains relationships with Flipkart. - Manage all aspects of a portfolio of Flipkart Vendor Central and Flipkart Marketplace accounts with the goal of growing revenue and profitability. - Develop and own the process and system to capture and disseminate product and campaign content to partners in an efficient manner that enables digital shoppers to notice, understand and purchase our brands online. - Identify areas of opportunities to increase traffic and conversions using key word research, sales analytics and tracking tools. - Establish and manage regular account, PDP and brand store audits to ensure we are compliant, optimized and displaying correct and current representation of our products and brand strategy. - Align with the demand planning and supply teams to ensure that we're always in stock, shipped on time and following Flipkart EDI and processing requirements and regularly managing and minimizing chargebacks. - Collaborate across sales, brand, ecommerce, marketing and media to ensure we're well coordinated across the platforms and focused on the best growth opportunities for our brands. - Understand and track our performance against our main competitors building and executing plans for us to increase our market share. column2: We are seeking an experienced and result-driven Manager of Customer Lifecycle Management to join   our team. As the Manager of Customer Lifecycle Management, you will play a critical role in effectively   managing the customer lifecycle journey, including customer onboarding, engagement, retention, and   driving successful campaign outcomes. We are looking for someone with a strong background in   customer lifecycle management, campaign management, and planning, with a demonstrated ability to   drive successful outcomes through data-driven decision-making         Key Responsibilities:         1. Analyses customer behaviour throughout the entire lifecycle, from Onboarding to retention   and re-engagement.   2. Identify key touchpoints, pain points, and opportunities for customer engagement and   improvement.   3. Develop and implement customer retention strategies, personalized communication plans,   and loyalty programs.   4. Execute targeted marketing campaigns to drive customer engagement and upsell/cross-sell   opportunities.   5. Analyses factors contributing to customer churn and develop strategies to reduce churn   rates.   6. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, sales, and product development,   to align strategies and improve customer satisfaction.   7. Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness of   customer lifecycle management initiatives.   8. Utilize data analytics and customer insights to segment customers and develop targeted   strategies for each segment. column2: The Marketing Specialist will be responsible for executing marketing activities to drive customer acquisition and cross-sell, including integrated marketing campaigns, product messaging, sales enablement materials, and campaign reporting and analysis. He/she will work closely with a team of geographically dispersed Marketing leaders to execute scalable, globally consistent marketing practices.         Marketing impact is measured on revenue sourced from marketing leads, brand awareness, new product launch effectiveness and overall effectiveness in coordinating with other relevant corporate functions and teams. Based in our Gurgaon, India office, this is an exciting time to join a growing international business.         The marketing team in Gurgaon is a key contributor to our global marketing and sales enablement department (~60 global associates) and accelerates sales productivity by developing product messaging & campaign strategy that is brought to market through experiential, digital, paid 3rd parties, unpaid media and sales channels.         What You Will Do:          Execute marketing activities to drive customer acquisition and cross-sell through integrated marketing campaigns, sales enablement materials, social media engagement and campaign reporting and analysis.     Develop compelling and concise content for our lead generation campaigns across various channels including website, email, social media etc.     Manage email marketing campaign execution by writing content, creating campaign tracking and partnering with our email deployment team.     Write and optimize public website content with a strong understanding of SEO     Draft ad copy for various paid social media campaigns such as LinkedIn Sponsored Updates, SEM ads etc.     Support marketing collateral creation and create effective sales enablement materials to improve sales teams ability to authentically engage with segments     Partner with marketing leaders in the US and Europe to develop a deep understanding of messaging and product offerings.     Collaborate across business lines and with colleagues in Gurgaon to identify, leverage and integrate marketing ideas and activities.     Review marketing performance using metrics and analytics, making recommendations and adapting marketing plans to incorporate best practices     Coordinate with marketing partners (Centres of Excellence) across the larger marketing organization to develop marketing assets, digital marketing campaigns, etc.             What You Will Need:             BS/BA degree or MBA degree on marketing or related field     2-3 years of marketing experience, including:     Strong English communication and written skills     Experience in executing multi-channel marketing campaigns     Experience with a CRM (salesforce or sugarCRM), CMS (Hippo or Adobe AEM), email management system (Eloqua) and Google Analytics preferred.         Intermediate/advanced Excel experience preferably ease with formulas and pivot tables.     Experience marketing to executive-level audiences     Experience in managing multiple senior stakeholders across geographies will be an added advantage             The ideal candidate will be:            Self-starter    - This individual must be adaptable, persuasive, tenacious, perceptive, and be able to respond appropriately to change. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work autonomously to manage and prioritize multiple tasks at one time.       Detail-oriented    - Pays attention to detail, self-QCs, makes a conscious effort to avoid mistakes and understand causes instead of just the effects. It shouldn t be something that you have to work at.       Project manager    - Ability to coordinate efforts cross-functionally to achieve positive end results. Excellent project management and execution skills, with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.       Collaborative    - Demonstrated initiative and resourcefulness; Ability to build relationships and work well with multiple partners across the Global Marketing Team and with key stakeholders across the business.       Communicator    - Must have strong presentation and writing/editing skills. Able to write grammatically correct sentences in an engaging way. Have a content and strategy orientation to marketing.       Intellectually Curious    - Ability to understand qualitative and quantitative research, the market landscape, new thought leadership and transpose the concepts into simple, engaging messages. Synthesize competitive information on an ongoing basis to inform marketing strategy.       Analytical    - Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.       Positive    - Approaches work with a positive attitude; views challenges or setbacks as opportunities to learn, improve processes and strengthen working relationships.

column1: Sr. Marketing Manager - Media and Automation
column2: The role entails integrated marketing lead, responsible for leading and managing the company s integrated marketing efforts to drive brand awareness, customer acquisition and revenue growth.      Responsibilities:        Overall:        - Generating leads through activities digital channels such as email marketing, SMS, RCS, WhatsApp.      - Implement best practices across the digital channels such as segmenting, targeting, frequency and deliverability.      - Should be able to optimize on the campaigns.        Email Campaign Management:        - Design, edit, test and deploy email campaign using communication tools.      - Create and manage multiple templates for email campaigns.      - Experience with marketing automation platforms and the ability to implement automated workflows for lead nurturing, scoring and personalized customer journeys.      - Experience in conducting A/B testing to optimize the campaign elements such as subject lines, visuals and calls to action for improved engagement.        Digital Media Planning:        - Deploy continuous lead generation digital campaigns and building customer journey from leads to acquisition.      - Conceptualize, develop, and execute digital marketing campaigns across various channels including digital, social media, email, content marketing.      - Generate and share reports on campaign performance optimizing strategies for enhanced performance.      - Monitor and manage lead progression through sales funnel.      - Coordinate with respective team to gather audience lists.      - Use data driven insights to assess campaign performance, identify areas of improvement and make data backed recommendations.      - Should be able to optimize the marketing ROI.        Marketing Automation:        - Building and monitoring automated campaigns across web and email.      - Building and testing workflows workflows and automation on multiple platforms (Hubspot, Moengage, etc.).      - Ensuring smooth execution of campaigns and troubleshoot in case of any issues.      - Using CRM and marketing automation tools to segment and target customers group effectively, ensuring personalized content is delivered to the right audience.      - Identifying new areas of automation, set-up and smooth running.          Skills Required:      - Bachelor s degree in Marketing and Business to a related fields ( master s degree preferred).      - Proven experience of 8-12 years in marketing.      - Proficient in email marketing, campaign management, lead generation.      - Familiarity with email marketing tools such as netcore, gupshup etc.      - Proficiency in MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and other Office 365 application.      - Proficiency in marketing analytics and data driven decision making.      - Strong familiarity with marketing automation tools and technologies.      - Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.      - Excellent communication and collaboration skills.      - Should be able to collaborate with various departments such as sales, product, IT, Customer support to align initiatives and execution.      - Manage relationships with external marketing agencies vendors, partners to support campaign execution and achieve marketing goals.      - Ensure all marketing activities comply with industry regulations and ethical standards.      - Should be abreast of current marketing tools used in marketing.

Marketing Automation:        - Building and monitoring automated campaigns across web and email.      - Building and testing workflows workflows and automation on multiple platforms (Hubspot, Moengage, etc.).      - Ensuring smooth execution of campaigns and troubleshoot in case of any issues.      - Using CRM and marketing automation tools to segment and target customers group effectively, ensuring personalized content is delivered to the right audience.      - Identifying new areas of automation, set-up and smooth running.          Skills Required:      - Bachelor s degree in Marketing and Business to a related fields ( master s degree preferred).      - Proven experience of 4-6 years in marketing.      - Proficient in email marketing, campaign management, lead generation.      - Familiarity with email marketing tools such as netcore, gupshup etc.      - Proficiency in MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and other Office 365 application.      - Proficiency in marketing analytics and data driven decision making.      - Strong familiarity with marketing automation tools and technologies.      - Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic environment.      - Excellent communication and collaboration skills.      - Should be able to collaborate with various departments such as sales, product, IT, Customer support to align initiatives and execution.      - Manage relationships with external marketing agencies vendors, partners to support campaign execution and achieve marketing goals.      - Ensure all marketing activities comply with industry regulations and ethical standards.      - Should be abreast of current marketing tools used in marketing.

Identify and connect with potential users through various channels, including social media, networking events, and partnerships. Lead the onboarding process for new users, providing guidance and support to ensure a seamless experience. Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights. Self-motivated and proactive, with a high level of initiative and a willingness to take ownership of projects and initiatives. Why Join Us: Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of talented professionals and make a meaningful impact on our growth journey. Opportunities for professional development and advancement. column2: Digital Marketing Strategy: Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies to drive brand awareness, generate leads, and increase conversions for our mobile app development services.              Campaign Planning and Execution: Plan, create, and execute digital marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including search engine marketing (SEM), social media advertising, email marketing, content marketing, and display advertising.             Content Creation and Optimization: Collaborate with the content team to develop compelling and engaging content for various digital platforms, including website, blog, social media, and email newsletters, ensuring consistent messaging and brand positioning.             Search Engine Optimization (SEO): Optimize website content and structure for search engine visibility and rankings, conduct keyword research, and implement SEO best practices to drive organic traffic and improve search engine rankings.             Social Media Management: Manage and grow our social media presence, including creating and scheduling content, engaging with followers, running social media campaigns, and monitoring social media analytics to identify opportunities for engagement and growth.             Paid Advertising: Plan and manage paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads, including budget allocation, targeting, ad creation, and performance monitoring.             Analytics and Reporting: Monitor, analyze, and report on the performance of digital marketing campaigns, using tools such as Google Analytics and marketing automation platforms, and provide insights and recommendations for optimization.             Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO): Identify opportunities to optimize the user experience, website design, landing pages, and conversion funnels to maximize lead generation and conversion rates.             Email Marketing: Develop and execute email marketing campaigns, including segmenting audiences, creating email templates, writing compelling copy, and analyzing campaign performance.             Market Research and Competitor Analysis: Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify industry trends, target audience preferences, and emerging opportunities, and incorporate findings into marketing strategies.             Collaboration and Coordination: Work closely with the design team, content team, and development team to align marketing initiatives with overall company goals and ensure consistent messaging and branding.                       Requirements              Experience: Minimum of 5+ years of experience in digital marketing, preferably in a B2B or technology-related industry.                      Digital Marketing Expertise: In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in planning and executing digital marketing campaigns across various channels, including SEM, social media, email marketing, content marketing, and display advertising.                     SEO Knowledge: Strong understanding of search engine optimization (SEO) best practices, keyword research, on-page optimization, and link-building strategies.                     Paid Advertising Skills: Proficient in managing paid advertising campaigns on platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and LinkedIn Ads, including campaign setup, targeting, and performance tracking.                     Analytics and Reporting: Proficiency in using digital analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, marketing automation platforms) to track, measure, and analyze campaign performance and generate actionable insights for optimization.                     Content Marketing: Familiarity with content marketing strategies, including content creation, distribution, and promotion across digital channels, and the ability to develop compelling and engaging content.                     Social Media Management: Experience in managing social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram) for business, including content creation, engagement, and analytics

column2: Who We Are At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward ??always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities. The Role Your Role and Responsibilities: Kyndryl is looking for talented and proactive partner-based engagement marketing specialists in the global partner marketing team. This high-profile role is a global role and is suitable for a strategic senior marketer with pursuit-based partner marketing experience. This role will be part of a team, tasked with the mission of developing a scalable marketing program in support of Kyndryl?? strategic alliance partners. The individual will be aligned to few strategic alliance partners of Kyndryl and will work closely with Kyndryl?? business leadership to develop a joint value proposition and marketing strategy for these alliance partners to drive business growth. The individual needs to develop deep understanding on the alliance partner dynamics, their competence and expertise level as well as key Kyndryl services offerings etc. The incumbent should be passionate, curious, have a growth mind set, love engaging with a wide range of stakeholders within Kyndryl and outside Kyndryl, creative and willing to take risks, bring innovation and be transformative. The ideal candidate should have expertise in: Strategy & Planning   Understand market dynamics and competitive landscape   Understand partners and ecosystem priorities and capabilities.   Develop joint marketing strategy and execution plan with the operating markets.   Understanding of the evolving partner ecosystems:      Hyperscalers, technology alliances, ISVs, as-a-service, sell-to, sell through, industry ecosystems etc.   Value propositions / how each model makes money / how they go to market.   Reputation, Relationship and Signing Growth    Design and execute targeted marketing tactics to drive Kyndryl brand reputation, relationship with target accounts and support signing growth.   Collaborate with the marketing automation and campaign team to tailor scalable programs and tactics.   Collaborate with Geo marketing understanding local market priorities and alliances alignment.   Data Driven credentials and strong understanding of performance marketing.   Pipeline & marketing metrics, program KPIs, root cause analysis. Who You Are Required Professional and Technical Expertise:   8+ years' relevant marketing experience in technology company or in a IT services / Global System Integrators, working on strategic partners go-to-market.   Master?? degree in marketing, Technology, or related field (MBA Preferred)   Experience or good understanding of the product marketing in the IT service industry.   Regularly review and adjust strategy and plan based on shifts in technology and market trends.   Create alliance marketing plans and coordinate across marketing, communication and sales enablement disciplines to accelerate Kyndryl results.   Proven history of working independently and with cross-functional sales, marketing, communications, and product management teams to achieve alliance objectives.   Participate quarterly business roadmap sessions with partners, aligning on strategies for mutual growth.   Good interpersonal, executive communication, peer-to-peer collaboration, writing and organizational skills.   Good analytical and negotiation skills and display good business acumen.   Good relationship building skills with the ability to engage with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.   Good team players and maintain the integrity and display good attention to detail.   Great presentation, verbal, and writing skills; ability to communicate complex ideas effectively across a wide range of audience levels and functions. Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise: Masters Degree in Marketing, Technology or related field (MBA preferred) Being You Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it?? how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we??e not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you ??and everyone next to you ??the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That?? the Kyndryl Way. What You Can Expect With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter ??wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee  learning programs  give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications,  including Microsoft,  Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed. Get Referred!   If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ??ow Did You Hear About Us??during the application process, select ??mployee Referral??and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

column2: Job Description    This is a 100% remote full - time position. All of our current Team is in Asia or Europe and so we prefer to hire people from Europe and Asia because of team collaboration. It is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in North America.   If you have had 3 years experience in marketing and are looking to progress to the next level ,  then this could be an exciting career move for you.    We are searching for an experienced ,  technical and self - driven Marketing Manager to create and lead our marketing team! As a Marketing Manager ,  you will mainly be responsible for developing and implementing all the marketing strategies with a clear focus on demand generation and content creation.   Must - Have Job Responsibilities:    -  Lead generation: define personas and create nurturing inbound and outbound campaigns based on needs assessment ,  verticals and territories using marketing automation systems.    -  Email campaign: develop prospect and customer segmentation ,  conduct analysis and create targeted and differentiated value propositions for an array of personas.    -  Content creation: create original and a variety of content in different mediums: Website copy ,  emails ,  landing pages ,  collateral; optimize Web content with SEO best practices.    -  Sales support: streamline the marketing to sales lead qualification process and provide sales tools ,  e.g. ,  corporate and product PowerPoint presentations ,  to expedite the sales cycle; must have participated in some sales methodology and training ,  such as solution selling ,  and familiar with pipeline stages.    -  Website: have design and navigation experience as well as content strategy experience for nurturing specific personas.    -  Marketing strategy: conduct competitor SWOT analysis and identify market trends.    -  Graphic design: create concepts for visuals for both internal and external campaigns and collaborate with graphic designers to execute them.    -  Reporting: create monthly reporting of all Marketing deliverables ,  status of projects ,  identify obstacles ,  provide solutions to overcome those obstacles.    -  Events: assist with major conferences ,  including booth design ,  invitation management ,  logistics ,  multimedia requirements and conference participation for analysts.    -  Internal communications: participate in internal sales and research analyst calls.    -  Social media: develop awareness and thought - leadership campaigns.    -  Create a marketing team Qualifications  -  At least 3 years experience in marketing (SaaS ,  a plus)    -  Being customer - centric    -  Hands on experience with CRM and SEO tools like Google Analytics ,  Google Adwords ,  etc.    -  In - depth knowledge of big data analysis    -  Regularly produce and present reports    -  Excellent organizational and time management skills    -  Good communication and interpersonal skills    -  Excellent presentation skills    -  MA in Marketing ,  Management or similar relevant field    -  Addition marketing certifications are a plus    -  This is a remote position

column2: If you are an experienced Demand Generation Manager with a passion for B2B SaaS, we are looking for you.  You will play a crucial role in driving campaigns and content for Hublers no-code platform. You'll have the opportunity to position our brand, share our story through content, run campaigns, and drive lead generation to grow Hubler in global markets. What we're looking for: Proven track record: You have a solid background in B2B marketing, specifically within the SaaS industry. Your expertise in developing and executing successful marketing campaigns will be key to our continued growth. Digital marketing: You are well-versed in various digital marketing channels and tools. From SEO and social media to content marketing and automation, you understand how to leverage these channels effectively to drive brand awareness and generate leads. Content: You have experienced in creating different kinds of content for the purpose of driving awareness and conversions. Bonus points if you have created long form content (like ebooks) and multimedia content (such as podcasts) for a startup. Ads: You are familiar with the customer lifecycle and can use search and social media ad platforms to drive conversions. Experience handling an ad budget and optimizing ad spend is a must. Strategic mindset: You possess a strategic mindset and can develop innovative marketing strategies to attract and engage our target audience. Your ability to analyze market trends and leverage data-driven insights will be instrumental in achieving our marketing goals. You must thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working cross-functionally with teams such as Sales, Product, and Customer Success.  If you possess these skills and have 3+ years of B2B marketing experience in a startup environment, we would like to speak with you.

column2: As an Email Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and executing email marketing campaigns to drive engagement, retention, and revenue. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create compelling content, segment audiences, and optimize campaign performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of email marketing best practices, excellent analytical skills, and a passion for delivering impactful campaigns. Key Responsibilities: Strategy      Development:  Develop and implement email marketing strategies aligned      with business goals, audience segments, and product offerings. Campaign      Execution:  Plan, create, and execute email marketing campaigns,      including designing templates, writing compelling copy, and scheduling      sends. Audience      Segmentation:  Segment email lists based on behaviours, demographics,      and other relevant criteria to deliver targeted and personalized content. Content      Collaboration:  Collaborate with the content team to create engaging      email content, including newsletters, promotional offers, product updates,      and more. A/B      Testing:  Conduct A/B tests on subject lines, email copy, design      elements, and calls-to-action to optimize campaign performance. Performance      Analysis:  Monitor key email marketing metrics (open rates,      click-through rates, conversion rates, etc.) and provide regular      performance reports with actionable insights. Automation:       Implement and optimize email automation workflows, including welcome      series, drip campaigns, and re-engagement campaigns. Compliance:       Ensure email marketing campaigns comply with relevant regulations (e.g.,      CAN-SPAM, GDPR) and best practices for data privacy. Collaboration:       Work closely with the design, content, and product teams to ensure email      campaigns are aligned with overall brand messaging and objectives. Continuous      Improvement:  Stay informed about industry trends, emerging      technologies, and best practices in email marketing, and identify      opportunities for innovation and optimization.   Qualifications: Bachelor's degree /MBA in Marketing, Communications, or a related field Preferred. Proven  Experience of 7+ years in email marketing, with a track record of driving      results and achieving KPIs. Strong understanding of email marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, Constant      Contact, HubSpot) and CRM systems. Proficiency  in HTML and CSS for email template customization is a plus. Excellent  written and verbal communication skills, with an eye for detail and      creativity. Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, generate insights, and make      data-driven decisions. Familiarity      with A/B testing methodologies and email marketing analytics tools (e.g.,      Google Analytics).
column11: Marketing Automation, Email Campaign, Segmentation, Email Strategy, Campaign Analytics, Marketing Campaigns, Email Marketing, Campaign Management, Ab Testing

Key Responsibilities         Conversion:         Drive month-on-month growth in Inc42 Plus (subscriptions) conversions through multiple channels like email, ads, whatsapp etc         Optimize user conversion journey across multiple touch points by conducting multiple a/b tests, personalisation, checkout form and payment gateway optimisation         Collaborate closely with the tech and UI/UX teams to enhance the products user experience across multiple touchpoints for Inc42 Plus         Setup cart abandonment infrastructure and improve cart recovery rate on a month on month basis         Retention:         Ensure Inc42 plus member engagement on a monthly basis through newsletters, member only community or on website         Build, optimize and evolve personalized onboarding experience on website, email and whatsapp for Inc42 Plus members to solve for discovery of Inc42 content, member only perks and features         Campaigns:         Conceptualise, create and execute multiple campaigns across the year for Inc42 Plus conversions         Collaborate with design, tech and UI/UX teams to ensure timely execution of all related activities         Present timely performance to all stakeholders on different milestones for each campaign         CRM Analytics         Maintain a robust and well-organised CRM for the contacts database.         Collaborate with the data team to ensure logical connections between data sources and destinations. Establish the analytics stack for Inc42 Plus, including platforms like Google Analytics and Amplitude.         Develop, maintain, and optimize segments to cater to various functional requirements.         Ensure the proper setup, optimization, and continuous improvement of all funnel dashboards serving both marketing and non-marketing functions across the company.         Reporting Operations         Design interactive dashboards to provide key stakeholders with insights into marketing journeys, funnel performance, and subscription growth.         Generate comprehensive reports and insightful dashboards for the marketing and editorial teams for regular reporting purposes.         Oversee and manage crucial processes related to CRM, customer success, telesales, product, and content feedback, ensuring consistent communication with all relevant stakeholders.           Professional Traits         4+ years of experience in growth, marketing or subscriptions, preferably from modern digital media or content-first digital company         Ability to communicate complex, disparate ideas in a structured and easy to consume way. Strong and structured writing ability is a must.         Has demonstrated strong experience in driving growth and scaling engagement or retention or conversion at a B2C company         Should have strong grasp on funnel optimisation, marketing automation, CRM, analytics         Must have a strong operational, analytical background, should be tech savvy and think from first-principles

column2: You will be responsible for growing our number of customers by leading a team of digital marketing professionals to build, execute, and opitmise multi-channel demand generation programs.          Working closely with the Demand Generation Director, acting as a 2IC of the Demand Generation team you will partner with the broader Marketing and Sales stakeholders to design and implement campaigns across the buyer journey.         Your keys to success will be your ability to build a deep understanding of our customers across our 2 markets (study abroad agents and institutions) and their pain points to create value-adding B2B campaigns that resonate with buyers across multiple channels and touchpoints.               Your Backstory            10 years experience in marketing campaigns, digital marketing, integrated marketing or related disciplines.         Leadership experience managing international remote teams to deliver marketing campaigns on-time, on budget and achieve the campaign objectives         Demonstrated prior success owning the planning, briefing, development, and execution for multichannel/integrated B2B marketing campaigns         Experience is managing integrated B2B lead generation campaigns across LinkedIn, Facebook, Google display network, SEM , SEO email         Extensive experience with Marketing Automation software such as HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot etc         Strong leadership and coaching experience with a track record of helping your team play to their strengths and succeed in their roles         Solutions-oriented, self motivated who thinks analytically, meets deadlines, and exceeds expectations         Strong collaboration skills with a natural ability for getting buy-in and bringing people together to deliver against a plan         Strong analytical skills, and proven track record in making data-driven decisions to continually optimize performance         Ability and desire to seek out new ideas and approaches, challenging the status quo on campaign approaches and media mixes         Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders across the marketing and sales teams to drive strategic alignment and maximise campaign impact         Develop a deep understanding of Adventus.io s customers, products, and buyer journeys to inform go to market strategy         Lead the campaign reporting framework to ensure the team continuously measure, analyse, and report on campaign performance to provide insights and learnings to leadership - weekly, quarterly, annually         Encourage the team to apply an experimentation mindset to drive a test, learn, and optimise cycles - employ A/B testing and other experimentation strategies         Oversee budgets and project plans to ensure campaigns launch on deadline and meet their objectives         Work closely with the sales and success teams to ensure effective lead handover between marketing and sales, and support sales outcomes

column1: Digital Engagement Manager (Email, App and Web)
column2: The Digital Engagement Manager is pivotal in our marketing team, overseeing communication across multiple channels, including email, web, and our CrossFit app      This role involves harnessing the power of enterprise digital platforms to boost customer engagement and loyalty through targeted marketing strategies      Beyond just email, this role demands a comprehensive grasp of digital marketing practices, coupled with adeptness in utilizing communication platform functionalities to segment audiences, tailor content, and refine campaign effectiveness      Working in tandem with various teams, the Digital Engagement Manager will spearhead the conception and implementation of campaigns that not only meet company goals but also elevate the quality of customer interactions              RESPONSIBILITIES:                  Email Marketing Management      : Overseeing the planning, execution, and optimization of email marketing campaigns to drive customer engagement and retention.                  Web Communication Strategy      : Developing and implementing strategies for web communication, including website updates, landing pages, and other web-based content to complement email campaigns.                  CrossFit App Notification Support      : Managing notifications and communication within the CrossFit app to keep users informed, engaged, and motivated.                  Braze Platform Utilization      : Leveraging the capabilities of the Braze platform to segment audiences, personalize content, and analyze campaign performance across email, web, and app channels.                  Campaign Development and Execution      : Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop creative campaign concepts and execute them effectively across different channels.                  Performance Monitoring and Optimization      : Monitoring key metrics and performance indicators to assess the effectiveness of campaigns and make data-driven decisions to optimize future efforts.                  Customer Experience Enhancement      : Contributing to the enhancement of the overall customer experience by delivering timely, relevant, and personalized communications across all channels.                  Collaboration and Communication      : Working closely with stakeholders across marketing, design, product, and other teams to ensure alignment of messaging and goals across all communication channels.                  Stay Updated with Industry Trends      : Keeping abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in email marketing, web communication, and app notifications to continually improve strategies and tactics.                  Reporting and Analysis      : Generating regular reports on campaign performance, conducting post-campaign analysis, and providing insights and recommendations for future improvements.              KNOWLEDGE, AND SKILL:              Proven leadership, ability to establish and maintain a positive work culture among a team, and ability to communicate effectively to both large and small workgroups.          Proficient in digital engagement platforms (e.g., Braze, Mailchimp, Constant Contact, etc.) and marketing automation tools.          Strong understanding of email marketing principles, segmentation, and testing methodologies.          Excellent copywriting skills with the ability to craft compelling and persuasive email content.          Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.          Familiarity with regulations and best practices related to email marketing compliance.          Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.          Experience working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.              EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE    :          Bachelor s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field.          Previous experience (3 years) in email marketing, preferably within the health and fitness industry.

column2: The company is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to develop and execute go-to-market strategies that align with company goals       The role involves understanding customers, target markets, and competitors, and working closely with cross-functional teams such as sales, product management, and customer success     The ideal candidate must be passionate, experienced, motivated, and comfortable with autonomy and multitasking     The Product Marketing Manager will be part of the marketing team and will work closely with executives, sales, product management, development, and customer success          What You'll Do:           Work closely with product management, corporate marketing, customer success, and sales to gather information about and understand the marketing needs for your products         Create messaging, positioning, content (e.g. data sheets, white papers, videos, case studies, solution briefs, product pitch decks, etc.).         Conduct webinars and ghostwrite blogs that articulate the value of Aisera and help generate demand and awareness.         Create messaging framework and key product proof points that are targeting various buyers personas and ICPs, as well as, product messaging focused industry-specific market verticals to highlight Aisera s unique differentiation         Create GTM assets and tools (e.g. playbooks, competitive battle cards, ring-the-bell sales win alerts, product newsletters, use case presentations and demo scripts), conduct product and sales enablement training, and contribute to sales support that helps enable the Sales team to qualify or close opportunities.         Lead cross-functional GTM team to ensure successful product launches.         Conduct frequent market and competitive analysis.         Assess sales win-loss data and drive corrective action where necessary.         Measure and drive adoption of products and solutions.           What You'll Need:           Solid understanding of technology and business backed by a Bachelor's or MBA degree         At least 5-8 years of medium to large B2B enterprise SaaS product marketing with some or all of that in IT Service Management,    Customer Service Experience, and IT Operations        Strong communication, product messaging, writing and presentation creation skills         Self-starter with high levels of initiative, accountability, and team leadership with prior technology startup experience and/or references that can vouch for this         Ability to manage multiple projects, set priorities, and meet deadlines with a sense of urgency         Knowledge of the sales process; preferably with solution-selling approaches         Public speaking skills and knowledge of AI/ML are a major plus

column2: As a Marketing Manager in the fire and safety industry one will play a pivotal role in strategizing, executing, and optimizing marketing initiatives to promote Bluescope products and services. Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and monitor multi-channel marketing campaigns including digital marketing, print media, events, and trade shows. Coordinate with internal teams and external agencies to ensure campaign success. Content Creation: Generate compelling content such as blog posts, articles, case studies, and whitepapers to engage the target audience and establish thought leadership in fire and safety solutions. Digital Marketing: Oversee digital marketing activities including website management, SEO, SEM, email marketing, and social media to drive traffic, generate leads, and enhance brand presence online. Lead Generation: Implement lead generation strategies to attract potential customers and nurture leads through the sales funnel. Collaborate with sales teams to optimize lead quality and conversion rates. Collateral Development: Create marketing collateral such as brochures, presentations, and product datasheets that effectively communicate the features, benefits, and value proposition of our fire and safety products Brand Management: Ensure consistency in branding across all marketing channels and communication materials. Safeguard the brand reputation by upholding high standards of quality and professionalism Customer Engagement: Develop initiatives to foster meaningful relationships with existing customers, promote customer loyalty, and encourage referrals. Performance Analysis: Monitor and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns, website traffic, and lead generation activities. Utilize data insights to optimize marketing strategies and maximize ROI. Budget Management: Manage marketing budgets effectively, allocate resources efficiently, and justify expenditures through clear ROI analysis. Developing Marketing Strategies, Developing Marketing Strategies, Digital Marketing, Brand Management Proven experience (5 to 8 years) in marketing roles within the fire and safety industry or related sectors. Strong understanding of fire safety regulations, industry standards, and compliance requirements. Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms such as Google Analytics, SEO tools, CRM systems, and marketing automation software. Excellent communication skills with the ability to create compelling content and deliver impactful presentations. Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, draw actionable insights, and make data-driven decisions. Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills with a results-oriented mindset. Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Demonstrated leadership capabilities with a track record of driving successful marketing initiatives.

column2: As the marketing operations manager, you will be the primary point of contact for Marketing and Sales for CRM-related issues. The ideal candidate will have an exceptional eye for detail and have managed CRM systems in fast moving businesses. The position will be responsible for CRM maintenance, data quality, process management across departments and be part of a team that delivers marketing automation campaigns, sales forecasting, productivity and other sales support functions.  You will ensure the quality and accuracy of our marketing systems integration, process automation, and data flow.  What You Will Do Refine the lead management process between HubSpot & Salesforce. Tasks include maintaining lead flow, velocity, and tracking across campaigns. Manage backend operations related to the flow of leads to Sales, ensuring leads are correctly qualified, routed, and followed up with. Key driver in maintaining the quality of data within CRM both in terms of contact & account data as well as the sales team processes. Create scalable systems to maintain the health of our marketing databases to ensure their usability and reliability and that they correctly synchronize across systems; leverage our enrichment tools to ensure our lead data is actionable and complete. Ensure systems support the smooth execution and reporting. Use analytics to identify weaknesses and make recommendations on how to improve across channels. Consult on operational best-practices, providing guidance on audience targeting and segmentation  as well as A/B testing strategies. Provide tracking and visualizations of progress of marketing programs across channels and build reports dashboards. Provide analysis and insights to facilitate decision making for marketing investments; identify areas within the customer journey that are strong and areas that could use improvement. Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets to help optimize campaigns for conversions through experimentation. What You Have Done 5+ years of experience working in hands-on experience working with Hubspot & Salesforce. 3+ years of experience with marketing, demand generation, marketing automation / operations/analytics. Bachelor's degree in marketing or a related field, or equivalent experience. Critical thinker and problem solver that strives for continuous process improvement. Strong ability to research system requirements and determine the steps necessary for proper      configuration. Able to effectively collaborate cross-functionally, partnering with stakeholders to drive      business performance.

column2: We are looking for an Email Marketing Manager to manage the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns. Professionals in this role should have experience in email marketing, segmentation, and automation. They must create visually appealing emails with relevant information that drives conversions, and measure campaign success to optimize future campaigns. Responsibilities: 1. Develop and execute email marketing campaigns to drive engagement, retention, and conversion. 2. Create compelling email content, subject lines, and designs to maximize open and click-through rates. 3. Segment email lists based on customer demographics and behaviors to optimize campaign targeting. 4. Monitor and analyze key performance metrics, such as delivery rates, open rates, and conversion rates, to continually improve campaign effectiveness. 5. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including design, content, and analytics, to ensure cohesive messaging and branding across all email communications. 6. Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in email marketing and apply them to enhance campaign performance. 7. Manage email marketing calendar and scheduling to ensure timely delivery of campaigns. 8. Implement A/B testing strategies to optimize email content and design elements. 9. Ensure compliance with email regulations, including GDPR and CAN-SPAM, and maintain email best practices. 10. Provide regular reporting and insights to stakeholders on the performance of email marketing efforts. Requirements: Bachelors degree in marketing, communications, or related field. Proven 1 year experience in email marketing or digital marketing roles. Strong understanding of email marketing best practices, including segmentation, personalization, and automation. Proficiency with email marketing platforms such as Mailchimp, Constant Contact, or similar tools. Excellent copywriting and editing skills with a keen eye for detail. Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions. Familiarity with HTML and CSS for email template customization is a plus. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Creative thinker with a passion for innovation and continuous improvement in email marketing strategies.  Working Days - Monday to Friday

column2: We are seeking an experienced and results-driven Digital Marketing Manager with a strong focus on performance marketing to join our dynamic marketing team. As a Digital Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing digital marketing campaigns to drive performance metrics and achieve business objectives. This role requires a deep understanding of performance marketing strategies, platforms, and analytics.         Responsibilities:         Performance Marketing Strategy: Develop and execute performance marketing strategies across various digital channels, including but not limited to paid search, display advertising, social media advertising, and affiliate marketing. Ensure alignment with overall marketing and business objectives.         Campaign Management: Plan, execute, and optimize digital marketing campaigns to drive desired outcomes such as customer acquisition, lead generation, conversion rates, and revenue growth. Continuously monitor campaign performance and make data-driven adjustments to maximize ROI.         Budget Management: Manage digital marketing budgets effectively, ensuring efficient allocation of resources across campaigns and channels. Monitor and report on campaign costs, performance, and KPIs to key stakeholders.         Conversion Optimization: Identify opportunities to improve website conversion rates and user experience through A/B testing, landing page optimization, and other conversion rate optimization techniques. Collaborate with the design and development teams to implement changes that enhance user engagement and drive desired actions.         Analytics and Reporting: Utilize analytics tools and platforms to track, measure, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) and campaign metrics. Generate regular performance reports and provide actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and inform strategic decision-making.         Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with internal teams such as creative, content, and product development to ensure cohesive brand messaging and alignment across all digital marketing channels. Provide guidance on best practices and industry trends related to performance marketing.         Stay Up-to-Date: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in performance marketing. Proactively identify opportunities for innovation and improvement in digital marketing strategies and tactics.           Responsibilities:         Experience: 2 to 3 years of agency experience and with a strong focus on performance marketing. Proven track record of managing and optimizing digital marketing campaigns to drive measurable results.         Performance Marketing Expertise: In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with performance marketing channels and platforms, including but not limited to Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, programmatic advertising, and affiliate marketing. Familiarity with marketing automation tools is a plus.         Analytical Skills: Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data, draw insights, and make data-driven decisions.         Results-Oriented: Demonstrated ability to set and achieve performance marketing goals and KPIs. Experience with conversion rate optimization and A/B testing is preferred.         Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders, conveying complex digital marketing concepts in a clear and concise manner.         Adaptability: Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to adapt to changing priorities and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.         Bachelor s Degree: A bachelor s degree in marketing, business, or a related field is preferred.
column11: Social media marketing, Customer acquisition, Display advertising, Campaign management, Social media, Marketing campaigns, Digital marketing, Marketing strategy, Analytics, marketing automation

column2: We are actively seeking an eCommerce Marketing Manager to work remotely on a full-time basis. This role is specifically designed for a strategic leader experienced in digital marketing and e-commerce within the US fashion apparel sector. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in developing online stores, particularly on Shopify, and setting up marketplace platforms from scratch, driving brand visibility, and achieving substantial e-commerce sales growth.             Key Responsibilities             eCommerce Platform Expertise: Spearhead the setup and optimization of e-commerce stores, particularly on Shopify, and manage integrations with various marketplaces to maximize sales channels.         Strategic Marketing Development: Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies that boost online presence and sales, with a particular focus on the US market.         Performance Marketing Leadership: Implement and refine performance marketing initiatives, including PPC, SEO, SEM, and targeted social media advertising to drive sales and improve ROI.         Creative Campaign Management: Oversee the entire creative process, ensuring that marketing materials effectively engage the US audience and reflect the brand s ethos.         Data-Driven Analytics: Utilize analytics to guide marketing decisions, optimize campaign performance, and enhance user engagement and conversion rates across all platforms.         Remote Team Dynamics: Lead a remote team by promoting a culture of innovation and accountability, ensuring timely delivery of marketing objectives and creative projects.             Qualifications             Educational Background: Bachelor s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.         Professional Experience: Minimum of 5 years in a leadership role in marketing, with extensive experience in setting up and managing Shopify stores and other e-commerce platforms.         Technical Skills: Proficiency in digital marketing tools and e-commerce technologies, including Adobe Creative Suite, Google Analytics, Shopify, and other CMS systems.         Strategic and Analytical Skills: Strong ability to develop strategic marketing plans and analyze performance metrics to drive business decisions.         Communication and Leadership Abilities: Outstanding communication and leadership skills, with experience managing remote teams and collaborating across departments. column2: Job Number  24078253   Job Category  Sales & Marketing   Location  Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway, 26/1 Dr. Rajkumar Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India  VIEW ON MAP    Schedule  Full-Time   Located Remotely?  N   Relocation?  N   Position Type  Management       JOB SUMMARY         The Marketing and Communications Manager is part of an important team that creates and executes property-level communications to our customers. Under the leadership of the Director of Marketing and Communication, this role promotes on-brand messaging to customers through traditional, digital, and social media channels all with the goal of enhancing the image of the hotel. This role helps build direct marketing plans, targeted campaigns, and activated channels to the end of driving consumer awareness and preference, increasing market share, and building broader portfolio and brand awareness. This role focuses on showcasing Food and Beverage promotions, both to hotel guests and to local patrons. As part of the Marketing and Communication team, this role is fully connected into resources in their region; Marketing and Communication Managers liaise and build deep partnerships with their regional eCommerce and Marketing teams to verify all local, social, and digital marketing efforts are effectively integrated with the selling efforts for the organization. This role also gets to do a little bit of everything, from balancing traditional and digital marketing and eCommerce activities to contributing to public relations (PR) activities for the hotel. Success is measured by how well they help drive the sales and revenue strategy of the property, social media engagement and also by how effectively leveraged the resources around them are to create truly compelling marketing and communications campaigns.         CANDIDATE PROFILE            Education and Experience           Required:       2-year degree from an accredited university in Marketing, Public Relations, Business Administration or related major and 4 years experience in the sales, marketing, digital or related professional area; hospitality marketing or digital advertising experience preferred   OR     4-year bachelors degree in Marketing, Public Relations, Business, or related major; 2 years experience in the sales, marketing, digital or related professional area; hospitality marketing or digital advertising agency experience preferred.         CORE WORK ACTIVITIES           Hotel Marketing and Advertising       Executes annual marketing plan to budget, in consultation with the GM, Food and Beverage leader, Operations leaders, Director of Marketing Communications, and cluster marketing and ecommerce teams.     Partners with Operations, Food & Beverage and Sales teams to execute promotions and campaigns to target in-house guests with promotions that drive incremental revenue to the hotel.     Acts as the liaison between the marketing department and advertising agency on the tactical advertising campaigns creative and media plans, particularly for food and beverage promotions.     Manages F&B media schedules and verifies prompt settlement of accounts.     Partners with property Revenue Management to verify correct offer loading, verifying advertisement targeting is correctly directed at relevant consumer groups     Executes email marketing, and display advertising.     Maintains frequent, active engagement with Cluster eCommerce manager to verify alignment, pull-through, and 2-way communication about the status, performance evaluation, opportunities, and issues related to online programs and initiatives.     Verifies all advertising for the hotel in digital channels is in alignment with brand voice.         Social Media Content Management       Facilitates social media engagement and updating content in local digital channels (e.g., hotel website, travel sites).     Develops and executes promotions campaign in F&B, weddings, spa, rooms and conferences through relevant digital and social media channels.     Engages in proactive online reputation management by surfacing relevant guest comments (positive or negative) in social media channels and responds accordingly.         Public Relations and Visual Asset Management       Develops a comprehensive PR plan per quarter along with agency and and executes post sign-off from GM.     Maintains a comprehensive list of local media contracts, with particular emphasis on food critics and bloggers.     Manages assigned accounts as per the media account management system.     Writes and distributes all press releases for property events, promotions, and outlets.     Manages the execution of hotel sponsored events, community/government relations activities, and press promotional activities.     Supports pull through of impactful PR strategy & activities to drive quality press coverage through media engagement, in alignment with communications objectives.     Verifies the news clippings and other online, print, and social media mention report is completed on a monthly basis for property distribution.     Manages external vendors and media agencies; works with agency partners and continent PR leader to identify strategic media buys for their hotel(s).     Surfaces and vets PR leads from the continent PR Leader regarding which are the best media to promote the hotel.     Supports the co-ordination of photography for F&B advertising, collateral and public relations purposes between the hotel, advertising agency and the regional field marketing teams.     Manages photo shoots for seasonal or festive promotions in partnership with the cluster or area marketing team.     Acts as central point of contact for regionally approved local photographers for food, amenity, and property imagery; coordinates with area or cluster marketing to verify all photography adheres to brand voice.         Direct Marketing and Collateral Development        Coordinates and executes Hotel and F&B printed materials.     Controls quantity and inventory of all Hotel marketing collateral and verifies copies are filed in a comprehensive manner.     Assists in the production of all property, F&B display, and temporary signage in hotel public areas.     Promotes collection of competitors collateral and publicity on a monthly basis.     Manages the execution of F&B direct marketing activities.     Verifies all collateral is as per brand standard guidelines and in compliance with Brand Standard Audit (BSA).         General       Assists and manages the development, co-ordination and execution of all communications activities with a strong emphasis on property F&B promotions and campaigns.     Helps with the publication of hotel s newsletter(s).     Supports communications duties and functions as deemed necessary.     Assists in the liaison and execution of joint F&B promotions.     Works with eCommerce to verify the Hotel s website and related websites are updated on a regular basis.     Partners with Director of Marketing to create marketing plan aligned to hotel sales and revenue strategy.     Provides training and marketing leadership and act as a marketing subject matter expert for GMs, Sales Leaders and Managers, and Revenue leaders.     Coordinates with property and above property eCommerce and Revenue Management teams to report success of property marketing and eCommerce performance.     Keeps abreast of competition and its collateral, advertising, and marketing efforts and constantly evolving digital and marketing trends.               Marriott International is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive, people-first culture. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, such as disability and veteran status, or any other basis covered under applicable law.       When you join the Sheraton family, you become a member of its global community. We ve been a place to gather and connect since 1937. At Sheraton, associates create a sense of belonging in more than 400 communities around the world. We invite, we welcome, and we connect guests through engaging experiences and thoughtful service. If you re a team player who is excited to deliver a meaningful guest experience, we encourage you to explore your next career opportunity with Sheraton. Join us on our mission to be  The World s Gathering Place . In joining Sheraton Hotels & Resorts, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.  Be  where you can do your best work,  begin  your purpose,  belong  to an amazing global team, and  become  the best version of you.
